name: Tunisia
description: Tunisia, officially the Republic of Tunisia, is a North African country with a rich history and diverse landscapes. Bordering the Mediterranean Sea, it boasts stunning coastlines, vast deserts, and the dramatic Atlas Mountains.  Known for its ancient ruins, vibrant culture, and delicious cuisine, Tunisia offers a unique blend of tradition and modernity.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The political and economic heart of Tunisia.
quickFacts.detail: Tunis is a sprawling metropolis with a historic medina and modern business districts.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A predominantly Arab population with Berber and European influences.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated along the coast and in the fertile plains.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small country with varied terrain.
quickFacts.detail: It's the smallest country in Africa by area.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: French is also widely spoken, particularly in business and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally stable.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A developing economy with tourism and agriculture as key sectors.
quickFacts.detail: Diversification efforts are underway to reduce reliance on tourism.

climateData.title: Climate of Tunisia
climateData.description: Tunisia experiences a Mediterranean climate, characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The coastal regions enjoy a more temperate climate than the interior.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Hot and dry, with temperatures often exceeding 35°C (95°F).  Sunshine is abundant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures gradually cool down, and rainfall increases.  The landscape transforms with autumn colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild temperatures, particularly along the coast, with occasional rainfall. The Atlas Mountains experience colder temperatures and snowfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures rise, and the landscape blooms with wildflowers.  It's a beautiful time to visit.

naturalWonders.name: Star Wars Set (Dougga)
naturalWonders.description: Dougga is one of the best-preserved Roman cities in North Africa, offering a fascinating glimpse into the region's ancient past. It was famously used as a filming location for the Star Wars prequel trilogy.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The city boasts impressive ruins of temples, theaters, baths, and residential buildings.  Its strategic location and prosperous trade made it a vital center of the Roman Empire.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for a deeper understanding.

naturalWonders.name: Chott el Jerid
naturalWonders.description: Chott el Jerid is the largest salt lake in North Africa, a vast and surreal expanse of shimmering white. It's a unique and otherworldly landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: During the summer months, the lake surface becomes a mirror, reflecting the sky and creating stunning optical illusions. It's a popular spot for off-road driving and photography.
viewingTips: Drive carefully on the salt crust.
Be aware of the extreme heat.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Bouden
naturalWonders.description: Mount Bouden is the highest peak in Tunisia, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. It's a challenging but rewarding climb.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is part of the Atlas Mountains and is known for its rugged terrain and diverse flora and fauna.  It's a popular destination for experienced hikers and mountaineers.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before you go.

ecosystemData.title: Tunisian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Tunisia's diverse ecosystems range from the Mediterranean coast to the Sahara Desert and the Atlas Mountains. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 20% of Tunisia's land area is protected.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Vegetation
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominated by drought-resistant shrubs, herbs, and trees adapted to the hot, dry climate.

statistics.details: A significant proportion are endemic to Tunisia.
Olive trees and Phoenician pines are common.

notableSpecies.name: Olive Tree
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Tunisia and a major agricultural product.

notableSpecies.name: Phoenician Pine
notableSpecies.significance: A rare pine species found only in Tunisia.

biodiversityCategories.name: Sahara Desert
biodiversityCategories.description: A vast and arid desert characterized by sand dunes, rocky plateaus, and sparse vegetation.

statistics.details: The Erg Chebbi dunes are among the highest in North Africa.
Adapted species include reptiles, insects, and desert foxes.

notableSpecies.name: Saharan Fox
notableSpecies.significance: A resilient species adapted to the harsh desert environment.

notableSpecies.name: Sand Viper
notableSpecies.significance: A venomous snake found in the Sahara.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds of Tunisia
biodiversityCategory.description: Tunisia is a haven for birdwatchers, boasting a diverse range of avian species, including migratory birds.

statistics.details: Many are migratory and rely on Tunisian wetlands.
Pass through Tunisia during spring and autumn.

notableSpecies.name: Barbary Macaque
notableSpecies.significance: The only macaque species found outside of Africa.

notableSpecies.name: Shaheen (Peregrine Falcon)
notableSpecies.significance: A powerful predator and a symbol of the Tunisian landscape.

activities.title: Activities in Tunisia
activities.description: Tunisia offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests, from exploring ancient ruins to enjoying the Mediterranean coast.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Tunisia on foot.

activities.name: Mount Kouribou Hike
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Kouribou, offering stunning views.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, appropriate clothing.

activities.name: Chenini Gorge Hike
activities.description: Hike through the dramatic Chenini Gorge, a narrow canyon with towering cliffs.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Mediterranean Sea with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Scuba Diving in Hammamet
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of Hammamet, known for its clear waters and diverse marine life.

activities.name: Windsurfing in Djerba
activities.description: Take advantage of the strong winds and shallow waters of Djerba for windsurfing.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves.

equipment.basic: Reusable water bottle, backpack, first-aid kit.
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass.
